parameter.name: publicIDpattern
parameter.description: PublicID creation pattern for an origin created by RTDD.

parameter.name: onlyPreferredOrigins
parameter.description: Relocate only preferred origins. Without this option scrtdd listens to LOCATION and try to relocate any origin. If this option is set scrtdd listens to EVENT and try to relcoate the preferred origin of an event.

parameter.name: manualOrigins
parameter.description: If disable manual origins are not relocated.

parameter.name: workingDirectory
parameter.description: Defines the directory used for storing temporary processing files.

parameter.name: keepWorkingFiles
parameter.description: Do not delete temporary processing files from the working directory after the processing is completed.

parameter.name: hypoddPath
parameter.description: Path to hypodd executable.

parameter.name: activeProfiles
parameter.description: Defines a list of active profiles.

parameter.name: profileTimeAlive
parameter.description: Defines how long the profile data should be kept in memory (in seconds). This is useful to release memory (catalog waveform data) after a period of inactivity at the cost of re-loading and re-process the waveforms whenever a new event occurs. A negative value force the profile to never expires (always in memory).

parameter.name: cacheWaveforms
parameter.description: Save catalog waveforms to local disk to avoid re-reading them from the configured recordStream when a profile is loaded (see profileTimeAlive). The waveforms are saved in the configured working directory and they can also be moved to other machines. Also it is safe to delete the cache, in which case the waveforms will be loaded and saved again on disk the next time the profile is loaded (they will be read again from the configured recordStream). Please note that exists a command line options '--load-profile-wf' useful to load the catalog waveforms from the record stream and save them on disk. This is useful to make sure all the data is ready when the module is started and avoid lenghty loading in case of big catalogs or slow network connection.

parameter.name: wakeupInterval
parameter.description: Specifies the interval in seconds to check/start scheduled operations. This is basically the time resolution for delayTimes option.

parameter.name: delayTimes
parameter.description: Specifies a delay time in seconds, relative to origin time, to trigger the processing. This can be a single value or a list of delay times. The list case can be useful when a quick solution is wanted but more data (e.g. waveforms) becomes available at a later time. In this scenario multiple times are configured so that an early solution is attempted and a more refined one is computed later. Example: "60, 120, 300, 3600"

parameter.name: logging
parameter.description: Enables/disables updating of a cron log file. This file will be created at ~/.seiscomp3/log/[appname].sched and contains information about the scheduled events and the processing queue. The file is updated each n seconds, where n = rtdd.cron.wakeupInterval.

struct.description: Defines a regional profile. Origins that fall in this region will use this configuration. If an origin falls in multiple profile regions, then the profile defined first will be used. The region check is not used for full catalog relocation (see --relocate-profile command line option)

parameter.name: regionType
parameter.description: Type of region: RECTANGULAR or CIRCULAR

parameter.name: region
parameter.description: Defines the region values. If regionType is RECTANGULAR then 4 values (min_lat, min_lon, max_lat, max_lon) are expected. If regionType is CIRCULAR then 3 values are expected (lat, lon, radius in km). If region is empty, then it will represent a region that matches any origin.

parameter.name: earthModelID
parameter.description: earthModelID that is stored in the created origin.

parameter.name: methodID
parameter.description: methodID that is stored in the created origin.

group.name: catalog
group.description: The files used to define a background catalog. New origins will be relocated using this catalog, which must contains high quality locations. In full catalog relocation mode (see --relocate-profile command line option) this is the catalog that will be relocated. There are two ways to define a catalog: one is providing an event file containing the ids of existing events or origins; the second way consists in providing extended information (useful when the events are not in the database) and three files are required event, phase and stations. The files must be in csv format with the first line containing the column names. Each file requires a minimum set of columns, which can appear in any order. Additional columns can be present and will not be used but are allowed for informationl purpose.

parameter.name: eventFile
parameter.description: Path to event file to be used for this profile. Seiscomp format required columns: seiscompId (this must be a valide seiscomp3 origin id or event id) Extended format columns: id,isotime,latitude,longitude,depth,magnitude,horiz_err,depth_err,tt_residual If the extended format is used, then the phase and station files must be provided. Conversely, if the format used is the one with seiscompId, no other files have to be provided and the event information will be fetched from the database.

parameter.name: phaFile
parameter.description: Path to catalog picks file to be used for this profile Columns: eventId,stationId,isotime,lowerUncertainty,upperUncertainty,type,networkCode,stationCode,locationCode,channelCode,evalMode

parameter.name: stationFile
parameter.description: Path to the stations file to be used for this profile Columns: id,latitude,longitude,elevation,networkCode,stationCode

parameter.name: P-Phases
parameter.description: Defines a priority list of accepted P phases. Phases not in the list will be discarded. if multiple phases exist for the same event/station pair, the first one in the list will be used.

parameter.name: S-Phases
parameter.description: Defines a priority list of accepted S phases. Phases not in this list will be discarded. if multiple phases exist for the same event/station pair, the first one in the list will be used.

group.name: step1options
group.description: Here are the options that control the creation of catalog absolute travel time entries for pairs of events (dt.ct file in HypoDD terminology), which are used in step 1 of real-time single-event relocation and and also in multi-event (full catalog) relocation (--relocate-profile command line option). The real-time relocation works in two steps: location refinement, the first step in which hypoDD compute a preliminary relocation of the origin using only catalog absolute travel times (dt.ct), which is controlled by those options, and a second step relocation, where scrtdd performs a more precise relocation using both catalog absolute travel times (dt.ct) and cross correlation differential travel times (dt.cc) for pairs of earthquakes, which is controlled by step2options. The multi-event (full catalog) relocation works in one step only, where the relocation is performed with both catalog absolute travel times (dt.ct) and cross correlation differential travel times (dt.cc), each one controlled by its respective options (step1options and step2options)

group.name: clustering
group.description: Those options control the creation of catalog absolute travel time entries (dt.ct file in HypoDD terminology) and cross correlation differential travel times (dt.cc file in HypoDD terminology) for pairs of earthquakes. To build the event pairs a clustering algorithm is performed, joining together events that have phases on same stations. Here it is possible to configure how the clustering is performed, selecting how/what events and phases will be used.

parameter.name: minNumNeigh
parameter.description: Min number of neighboring events required to relocate an event. Check disabled by default.

parameter.name: maxNumNeigh
parameter.description: Max number of neighbors used. Further events are discarded. No limit by default.

parameter.name: minObservationPerEvtPair
parameter.description: Min number of differential travel times (Including P+S) per event pair required. Event pairs not satisfying this condition will not be used. Check disabled by default.

parameter.name: maxObservationPerEvtPair
parameter.description: Max number of differential travel times (Including P+S) per event pair used. If this value is set, closer stations will have higher precedence over further ones. No limit by default.

group.name: neighboringEventSelection
group.description: This option define how neighbouring events are selected. From Waldhauser 2009: to assure a spatially homogeneous subsampling, reference events are selected within each of five concentric, vertically elongated ellipsoidal layers of increasing thickness. The dimension of the ellipsoid is based on the assumed error in the routine locations and the maximum interevent distance over which model errors can still be effectively minimized (see Waldhauser, 2001). The layers are twice as thick at the poles than they are at the equator to accommodate the generally larger error in the depth of the routine location of a new event. Each layer is split up into its eight quadrants (or cells), and the neighboring events are selected from each of the 40 cells. Note: if numEllipsoids is 0 then the concentric ellipsoid algorithm will not be used and the events will be selected on nearest neighbor basis within a search distance of maxEllipsoidSize. This is useful when performing multi-event relocation to build a background catalog where we seek a network of links between events so that there exists a chain of pairwise connected events from any one event to any other event, with the distance being as small as possible between connected events

parameter.name: numEllipsoids
parameter.description: Number of concentric ellipsoidal layers to use in neighboring events selection.

parameter.name: maxEllipsoidSize
parameter.description: Horizontal axis length (km) of the outermost boundary. Each inner concentric layer axis will be of size/2 of the previous one. Please note that the horizontal axis size is half of the vertical one.

group.name: phaseSelection
group.description: This option define how event phases are selected.

parameter.name: minWeight
parameter.description: Min phase weight required. Phases not satisfying this condition will not be used. Check disabled by default. The weighting scheme is based on pick class: weight = (1 / 2^class). The class is derived from pick time uncertainties: Class 0: 0-0.025 sec, class 1: 0.025-0.050 sec, class 2: 0.050-0.100 sec, class 3: 0.100-0.200 sec, class 4: 0.200-0.400 sec, class 5: over 0.400 sec. Picks without uncertainties have a fixed class of 1 if manual and class 4 if automatic.

parameter.name: minStationDistance
parameter.description: Min distance (km) between event pair and station required. Phases belonging to stations not satisfyig this condition will not be used. Check disabled by default.

parameter.name: maxStationDistance
parameter.description: Max distance (km) between event pair and station allowed. Phases belonging to stations not satisfyig this condition will not be used. No limit by default.

parameter.name: minStaionToEventPairDistRatio
parameter.description: Min ratio between event-station distance and pair inter-event-pair distance. Phases belonging to stations not satisfyig this condition will not be used. Check disabled by default.

parameter.name: controlFile
parameter.description: Path to hypoDD control file (e.g. some_path/hypoDD.inp) to be used with hypoDD. The input/output files will be replaced by SCRTDD with its own files, thus the values at those lines are not relevant.

group.name: step2options

group.name: findMissingPhase
group.description: Use cross correlation to find undetected event phases on stations for which other close by events have phases.

parameter.name: enable
parameter.description: Enable the detected and creation of new phases

parameter.name: fixAutomaticPhase
parameter.description: Use cross correlation to improve the picks of existing automatic phases (manual phases will be left unchanged)

parameter.name: maxEventPairDistance
parameter.description: Maximum distance (km) to look for events to be used. Phases belonging to the events falling in the selected area will be used for detecting missing phases via cross correlation.

parameter.name: numCC
parameter.description: Number of cross correlations above threshold required to define a new phase.

parameter.name: maxCCtw
parameter.description: Maximum time window to be used in the cross correlation. This parameter is used to restrict the search window, although the actual windows is derived from the difference between maximum and minimun travel time of the phases belonging to the near by events, which are selected depending on the maxEventPairDistance parameter

group.name: waveformFiltering
group.description: Filter waveforms before performing the cross correlation

parameter.name: filterString
parameter.description: SeisComP3 string based filter definition

parameter.name: resampling
parameter.description: Resample all traces at this samplig interval (hz)

group.name: snr
group.description: Exclude phases from cross correlation when Signal to Noise Ratio is below a configured threshold.

parameter.name: minSnr
parameter.description: Minimum Signal to Noise Ratio value required to use a Pick in cross correlation. If minSnr is used, then the noise and signal windows must be defined too.

parameter.name: noiseStart
parameter.description: Start of noise window with respect to pick time (+/- secs)

parameter.name: noiseEnd
parameter.description: End of noise window with respect to pick time (+/- secs)

parameter.name: signalStart
parameter.description: Start of signal window with respect to pick time (+/- secs)

parameter.name: signalEnd
